sentence.text: Finally, further analysis of the TCGA data demonstrated SASS6 upregulation in a modest manner in 8 of 11 cancer muscle organ developments other than colon cancer, and SASS6 upregulation was found to be associated with a poor survival outcome in patients with kidney renal cell carcinoma and lung adenocarcinoma.
In the present study, we examined whether centriole replication expression is abnormally regulated in colorectal cancers (CRCs).

Next, using DLD-1 colon cancer cells inducibly expressing centriole replication, SASS6 overexpression was shown to induce centrosome amplification, mitotic abnormalities such as chromosomal misalignment and lagging chromosome, and chromosomal numerical changes.
To date, the genetic alteration of centriole replication has not been reported in human cancers.
